A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Political correctness is beginning to erode all forms of media and not even Star Wars is beyond the reach of ideological vandalism. As much as I disliked the prequels\, they at least had the same Star Wars spirit as the original movies. The Last Jedi puts forward ideological themes at the expense of the story and characters\, it blatantly disrespects what built the franchise which ultimately pushed Mark Hamill himself to fundamentally disagree with everything the writers decided for his character.

The new main character which we are supposed to root for is inherently good at everything; she doesn't grow\, learn or make any mistakes. Rey is simply a projection of an ideal main character rather than a character that develops through their journey and through the story.

In short Star Wars has lost it's most important aspect\, the most important aspect of any film: Its heart. Rather than making Star Wars more inclusive and enjoyable for all people the terrible writing has fans of the franchise more divided than ever.
